A big "Thank you" to Misha Pepsi Mam, We are writting this review after successful delivery of our beautiful 'Girl Baby' a week ago. Misha mam was so supportive thorough out our entire  pregnancy process. Inspite of her busy schedule and multiple appointment we wonder how she was able to give same level of detailing and attention every time we visited her. We are sure that she gives same attention to every single patient who visit her every time. One cannot simply do this all the time, unless they are so dedicated to their profession. No matter what time it is, she is always available for her patients either through call or whatsapp whenever they need. In the past we have seen doctor's who carry vast knowledge, very good command over the language but zero empathetic or zero compassionate, with average listening skills. ** *** ***** **** ***** *** **** * **** ********* *** ********** ** *** ****** ** a very good listener who is very empathetic and humane towards her patients. In our life time we will come across only very few doctors with this combination of being strong, outspoken at the same time empathetic and compassionate towards their patients. Misha mam is one such of a gem. We were overwhelmed with the flexibility and understanding that Misha mam has shown for our personal requests, especially during the delivery, post care and discharge. Definitely she carries a positive aura around her wherever she goes. We would highly recommend this doctor for anyone who is looking for a wonderful and dedicated gynecologist.

PS : Ours was a risky pregnancy with placenta previa, transverse lie and high BP (at the time of delivery). Post delivery mam checked on me daily to ensure I am recovering well. She gave many useful recommendations following which I was able to walk the second day and got discharged 3rd day.

Thanks & Regards

review: I would like to share my experience of birth of my Princess. The first time when I visited her, I was really happy with her friendliness, how patiently she answered all my questions and she was so polite and patient to answer all my silly questions as well. But the thing which I really liked about her was, when she said "you and baby is more important to me, so take care, eat healthy and u don't have to worry for anything else" and that really touched me. At the very first visit, she asked me to call her or text her in case of any doubts or emergency. I remember, during pregnancy I had little complication and when I called Doctor Misha, she was not in town but eventhough she wasn't here I felt her presence as she managed everything perfectly; she asked me to go and check with a specific doctor and send her reports through whatsapp but what Amazed me more about her was, when she returned back, the very same morning she asked me to come and meet her to make sure everything is perfect.I had bp problem throughout my pregnancy and she was always there to guide me, motivate me and always there with her positive words to overcome any thoughts which was troubling me.When I was near my edd, I got symptoms of eclampsia which Doctor Misha noticed and started following up with me every few hours. I was in awe of her, when she called me like at every few hours to check on my bp and then she called me around 12 in the morning to check if my bp is okay and since it was really high, she asked me to get admitted as we had to do emergency C section. I was really scared cause everything was happening so fast and as my Edd was 13 May and it was only 6th May and at the same time I was relaxed knowing that Doctor Misha is there, as she always took care of me and the baby. I reached hospital around 1: 30 am, Doctor Misha was already on the way and when she came to see me, she said "she will not take any chance with my life or baby's life and she will take care of everything and soon I will have my baby in my arms" and when she said those words, that little fear which I had before coming to hospital, everything was gone and I was more n more excited to meet my little one and soon after I am blessed with a baby girl.Really Hats off to her dedication, as even in in this lockdown situation, she was there in hospital early in the morning and she also arranged anesthetist and pediatrician that too around 2 am.After delivery when she came to see me, I was really happy to see her, as she told me that she will make sure everything goes perfectly and I dont have to go through lot of pain. Before leaving the hospital, she asked me to call her in case of any severe pain or doubts. And she was constantly following up with nurses in the hospital and getting update on me and baby.But due to unexpected circumstances I had to get discharge from hospital soon after delivery, even after that she was constantly texting and calling to check on me and baby.When I couldn't visit her after delivery, she did video call to make sure everything is perfect. I am really thankful to Dr Misha for everything she did throughout my pregnancy, for all the care and support and even now when I contact her, she is always there to help me out.Ladies, trust me.. you don't have to be worried about anything, *** *** *** **** ******* she will always make sure that the mother and baby is safe and healthy.To Doctor Misha, Thank u so much for everything, from the first time when I met you; you were always there for me as a sister guiding me, motivating me throughout my pregnancy and I am really lucky that I met you.

review:
Though it's going to be a long message, pls take some time to read as many new moms here will get confidence in their pregnancy journey 

Am a mom of two child and I really want to share my experience here which will make evryone to go through many obstacles in their pregnancy.

Previous pregnancy (First child- girla baby- last year)

Last year was very much tedious year for many pregnancy ladies and am a part of that period where I was very much afraid and I couldn't go for my regular check ups properly. I was facing fibroid issue and single umbilical artery. The thing is I had my check ups in one hospital and final stage I have been moved to another hospital because of covid severity which was very much a last min surprise for me. God's Grace atlast me and baby was doing well except with the result of covid- positive which made my baby to loose breast milk. I thought that was my hectic period and I have been saved by God but there was another major health problem which I didn't even notified.

Second pregnancy ( second baby - boy - this month August)

Again I was having my regular check ups with my usual hospital.suddenly at my fifth month I got very much afraid as covid severity was increasing and I was rolled out with the imagination of last year and I thought of put an end to the usual hospital for check ups. Beside this I skipped one month check up (6th month) because of this panic situation. At seventh month I remembered Dr. Misha pepsi mam to whom I went check up for once last year at ninth month where mam instructed me that I should strictly go with normal delivery beyond the visibility of fibroid as it is not going to play a major role in normal delivery and I was very much afraid of normal delivery  which made to put an end to her visit.

To be very Frank at this pregnancy for first check up (7th mnth) I really don't have confidence as I have changed my gyno at last moment. From second check up she gave me very much confidence and i literally says that I want your presence mam pls be beside me even if am stated as covid positive and you gonna move me to some other hospital. This was my tharaga mantra for all check ups I went. Her words were very positive saying like "you are not going to be in that state and am the one who gonna deliver your baby for sure so don't worry". Happily 7th and 8th month passed with her positive words.

Here comes the most surprise I faced at ninth month. I was asked to take ecg/echo and I was notified that I have ASD in heart ( hole in heart from child birth).
